body_html:
DeepDream almost works with Python 3.5. I've submitted a pull request in #4366 but until then, you can just change the line in strip_consts to:

tensor.tensor_content = bytes("<stripped %d bytes>"%size, 'utf-8')

Python 3.5 seems to be stricter about implicit conversions, in this case refusing to convert string -> byte without knowing the encoding (which defines the conversion,)
body_text:
DeepDream almost works with Python 3.5. I've submitted a pull request in #4366 but until then, you can just change the line in strip_consts to:
tensor.tensor_content = bytes("<stripped %d bytes>"%size, 'utf-8')

Python 3.5 seems to be stricter about implicit conversions, in this case refusing to convert string -> byte without knowing the encoding (which defines the conversion,)
body:
DeepDream almost works with Python 3.5. I've submitted a pull request in #4366 but until then, you can just change the line in strip_consts to:

```
tensor.tensor_content = bytes("<stripped %d bytes>"%size, 'utf-8')
```

Python 3.5 seems to be stricter about implicit conversions, in this case refusing to convert string -> byte without knowing the encoding (which defines the conversion,)
